comments: Numbers represented by quadratic form with Gram matrix [ 2, 1; 1, 3 ].
references: H. Cohn, A second course in number theory, John Wiley & Sons, Inc., New York-London, 1962. see page 3.
links: N. J. A. Sloane et al., Binary Quadratic Forms and OEIS (Index to related sequences, programs, references)
formula: List contains 0 and all positive n such that 2*A035170(n) = A028586(n) is nonzero. - _Michael Somos_, Oct 21 2006
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
extensions: More terms from Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), Mar 29 2000
